text: Candida albicans is a yeast which causes oral and genital infections in humans. The infection is candidiasis, better known as "thrush". It is treated with antimycotics (anti-fungal drugs). C. albicans biofilms readily form on the surface of medical devices. Hospital-related infections in patients are a major health concern. C. albicans is among the gut flora, the many organisms that live in the human mouth and gastrointestinal tract. Under normal circumstances, it lives in 80% of the human population with no harmful effects, although overgrowth results in candidiasis. You can visit this article on another language for more information as this version of the article lacks information that have been added to other languages. You could also go to Wikispecies. category:Fungi
title: Candida albicans
